CatDescriptText: Mrs. Mary Lee, married housewife, 506 First St., Turtle Creek, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 26, 1959, pg. A1, with question: "Do you believe in divorce even though most religious groups frown upon it, and some actually ban it except under very extenuating circumstances?" answer reads: "If there are children, there shouldn't be a divorce. However, there are some people who are impossible to get along with.  Therefore a divorce is all right.  Peace of mind is a good thing to have."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mary Lee wearing light colored coat with dark collar and cuffs, standing with arms crossed, on sidewalk in front of store window with display of men's suit, pedestrians in window reflection
